TopicTitle: [1.8-1.12] Kethane Plugin and Parts 0.11.0 - Now with background scanning.

Articles.Content: @archiebald: I just tried it in 1.8.1, with and without MH and BG, and it loaded without any issues other than that message box. It must be another mod.

@taniwha My main 1.8.1 folder has 64 other mods all installed and living together very happily with zero errors.

For testing, I just created a new vanilla folder for a clean1.8.1 install.

With 1.8.1 and Kethane only, I get the error message that Kethane is incompatible with 1.8.1, however the games starts correctly and the assets are correctly displayed.

With MH 1.8.1 installed, I get the same result, then with with MH + BG 1.3.1 installed, I also get the same result which is as per your findings. 

It seems that despite the incompatibility message, Kethane can work on the vanilla game.  However, it is not capable of co-existing with my other mods.  Unfortunately, since it is being outvoted at 64 working mods to 1 non-working mod, then it seems I won't be using it. 

Since the Kethane error message is occurring on the vanilla install, then as a lay person I'd have to assume that the fault lies somewhere in Kethane.  Sorry, I don't have the time or inclination to filter through all my mods one at a time to find where the conflict is, but if there is a start-up log file I can send you to help you troubleshoot your mod, please let me know.

If it helps, here is my mod list.

Edited April 17, 2020 by archiebald

That message box comes from mods, it is NOT a stock KSP thing. I actually have a very strong suspicion as to which mod is blocking the load, but I currently have no proof, so won't say which (but the hint is it's probably the reason you're still on 1.8.1, and I know of only one such mod)

@taniwha Please see my previous post, I added my full mod list just in case it helps your troubleshooting

I'm still on 1.8.1 because of three reasons.  1) the 1.9.1 planet textures suck 2) Scatterer is not yet available to fix the awful textures, 3) Several other mods are still not updated.

I'm confused by this, "That message box comes from mods, it is NOT a stock KSP thing"

The error message box I mentioned is happening on a VANILLA install of 1.8.1 with only Kethan added.

@taniwhaIf you have a suspicion of which mod it is, please tell me.  If it only a matter of testing one conflict, then I can do it for confirmation....just don't have time to test all 64.

2 hours ago, archiebald said:

During loading, an error box comes up which you can clear, but then at the end of the loading sequence, the message in white text at the bottom of the screen says;

Mod(s) DLL that are not compatible with this version of KSP

1.0.7092.28523 GameData\Kethane\Plugins\Kethane.dll

A text search for the error turns up this from ModuleManager:

  • https://github.com/sarbian/ModuleManager/blob/d172fc66ff56ffdc665ea47a3a143df8f17f441c/ModuleManager/ExceptionIntercept/InterceptLogHandler.cs#L43

Looks like that was added in November 2019.

Thank you for the list. Interestingly, the mod I suspected is NOT in there, so I'm glad I didn't go naming names.

And yes, that message box will be there with just stock KSP (no DLC) and kethane, because kethane itself pops up that box. The problem is that some other mod has been coded to pop up the same list (dll magic sorted out a few years ago), but 1) that mod gets to pop up the list rather than kethane, 2) that mod has decided that any mod that says "dunno" means that the game must not load.

As for how to find the mod: bisect your mods.

  1. remove half your mods (eg, starting with A-M)
  2. test:
    1. if test passes, add half the mods that are currently still removed
    2. if test fails, remove another half of your mods (eg, N-T) (or, in later steps, half the mods you just added)
    3. repeat

It's tedious, but it works (and is a lot less tedious than doing it one by one)

However...

Thanks @HebaruSan. I'll just have to fix Kethane's check (was going to anyway, but I wanted to know what mod was causing the problem so I could say "now works with...")

So I had purple squares and an error about the shaders, and saw that you may be working on that. When i use the dl provided it doesn't seem to have the particles disabled. I did find a workaround that will remove the squares but has no textures. in the part.cfg "Particles/Additive" was the 2017 path, since the change it is now mapped under legacy shaders. To remove the texture error changing it to "Legacy Shaders/Particles/Additive" removes the error but like i said no particle effects. It looks like all that is needed is creating a empty and making the particles a prefab then spawn the particles on the empty. Making the particle shouldn't be too hard, all the particle specs are in the cfg's, just some translation required.  

Now I pulled apart the models and realized there are alot more animations than i realized existed. Now, in an effort to save myself from remapping the anims, I noticed there is a Git, but seems like it is way out of date, I also saw you were more focused on something else. Is there a place like git I could help collab with the particles? I also have a discord Vextryyn#5252 if you want to DM me.

@vextryyn: yeah, it seems my attempt at disabling particles didn't go as planned. If you can help out with particles, that would be wonderful. The best way to contribute is via github PRs. This is the repo you want: https://github.com/taniwha/Kethane (and maybe https://github.com/taniwha/GeodesicGrid).

Can someone tell me how to get the grid system from displaying on the opening screen when you launch KSP?

Its cosmetic I know but annoys me since I love the display with scatterer.
@SkiRich it's also part of knowing that Kethane is installed and working. Anyway, edit GameData/Kethane/settings.cfg and add ShowInMenu = False

3 hours ago, taniwha said:

@SkiRich it's also part of knowing that Kethane is installed and working. Anyway, edit GameData/Kethane/settings.cfg and add ShowInMenu = False

Awesome thank you for this.

Edited September 5, 2020 by Yurif
Does anyone know why the drills ain't drilling nor adding units up in the container?

@adriangm44 There are quite a few possibilities. Are you using the correct drills? (kethane, not stock). Is the working end in the ground? Do you have sufficient EC? Is the drill in a deposit hex? Has the deposit been drained? Is the container correct (holds kethane) and on the same vessel as the drill?

It is actually quite possible for a vessel to be right on the edge of a hex such that the vessel is "in", but the drill is "out" (and thus no draw).

Unfortunately, the particle feedback isn't working yet (I am working on it, though, and have it going, but it has a few issues I need to fix before release).

Has anyone tried this mod with 1.12?  I'll give it a try and see how it goes.

I have released version 0.11.0 of Kethane. Built against KSP 1.9, tested in 1.12.

Changes from 0.10.3:

  • Don't request drills on a station.
  • Update particle system to use shuriken (ie, particles are back).

There are some minor niggles with particles: sometimes they're emitted in an unexpected direction, and taking off from an active site will cause the particle system to follow the ship. However, I figured it's better to get a release out for those who still enjoy Kethane.

3 hours ago, taniwha said:

I have released version 0.11.0 of Kethane. Built against KSP 1.9, tested in 1.12.

Changes from 0.10.3:

  • Don't request drills on a station.
  • Update particle system to use shuriken (ie, particles are back).

There are some minor niggles with particles: sometimes they're emitted in an unexpected direction, and taking off from an active site will cause the particle system to follow the ship. However, I figured it's better to get a release out for those who still enjoy Kethane.

Thanks taniwha! I'm one of the people who still use this mod
